name: tckedit
description:
Perform various editing operations on track files.

This command can be used to perform various types of manipulations on track data. A range of such manipulations are demonstrated in the examples provided below.

References:
author: Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au)

inputs.name: tracks_in
inputs.description: the input track file(s)

inputs.name: tracks_out
inputs.description: the output track file

inputs.name: include
inputs.description: specify an inclusion region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). Streamlines must traverse ALL inclusion regions to be accepted.

type.name: include
type.description: specify an inclusion region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). Streamlines must traverse ALL inclusion regions to be accepted.

inputs.name: spec
inputs.description: specify an inclusion region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). Streamlines must traverse ALL inclusion regions to be accepted.

inputs.name: include_ordered
inputs.description: specify an inclusion region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). Streamlines must traverse ALL inclusion_ordered regions in the order they are specified in order to be accepted.

type.name: include_ordered
type.description: specify an inclusion region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). Streamlines must traverse ALL inclusion_ordered regions in the order they are specified in order to be accepted.

inputs.name: image
inputs.description: specify an inclusion region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). Streamlines must traverse ALL inclusion_ordered regions in the order they are specified in order to be accepted.

inputs.name: exclude
inputs.description: specify an exclusion region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). Streamlines that enter ANY exclude region will be discarded.

type.name: exclude
type.description: specify an exclusion region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). Streamlines that enter ANY exclude region will be discarded.

inputs.name: spec
inputs.description: specify an exclusion region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). Streamlines that enter ANY exclude region will be discarded.

inputs.name: mask
inputs.description: specify a masking region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). If defined, streamlines exiting the mask will be truncated.

type.name: mask
type.description: specify a masking region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). If defined, streamlines exiting the mask will be truncated.

inputs.name: spec
inputs.description: specify a masking region of interest, as either a binary mask image, or as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). If defined, streamlines exiting the mask will be truncated.

inputs.name: maxlength
inputs.description: set the maximum length of any streamline in mm

inputs.name: minlength
inputs.description: set the minimum length of any streamline in mm

inputs.name: number
inputs.description: set the desired number of selected streamlines to be propagated to the output file

inputs.name: skip
inputs.description: omit this number of selected streamlines before commencing writing to the output file

inputs.name: maxweight
inputs.description: set the maximum weight of any streamline

inputs.name: minweight
inputs.description: set the minimum weight of any streamline

inputs.name: inverse
inputs.description: output the inverse selection of streamlines based on the criteria provided; i.e. only those streamlines that fail at least one selection criterion, and/or vertices that are outside masks if provided, will be written to file

inputs.name: ends_only
inputs.description: only test the ends of each streamline against the provided include/exclude ROIs

inputs.name: tck_weights_in
inputs.description: specify a text scalar file containing the streamline weights

inputs.name: tck_weights_out
inputs.description: specify the path for an output text scalar file containing streamline weights

inputs.name: info
inputs.description: display information messages.

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: display debugging messages.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: value
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: help
inputs.description: display this information page and exit.

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: display version information and exit.

output-files.name: tck_weights_out
output-files.description: specify the path for an output text scalar file containing streamline weights
